claims:
1. A method of analyzing an image of a volume of tissue of a breast, comprising:
receiving at least one ultrasound tomography image of the volume at a computing system;
determining a volume averaged sound speed within the volume using the computing system; and
determining a risk of developing breast cancer from the volume averaged sound speed.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the volume comprises at least 30% of a whole volume of the breast.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the image of the breast does not comprise a cancerous mass.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the image of the breast comprises a breast of a patient less than 40 years old.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the image of the breast comprises an image of a contralateral breast of a cancer affected breast.

6. The method of claim 1, further comprising: determining a volume (V) of the volume of tissue by a direct pixel count of a plurality 2D images within a stack of 2D images and determining the volume averaged sound speed by summing a sound speed for each pixel within the direct pixel count and dividing by the volume.
7. The method of claim 1, further comprising incorporating a parameter related to the risk into a risk model.
8. The method of claim 7, wherein the risk model comprises a Gail model or a Tyrer-Cuzik model.
9. The method of claim 1, further comprising determining a percent of high sound speed tissue of the breast from the at least one ultrasound tomography image of the volume.
10. The method of claim 9, wherein determining the percent of high sound speed tissue comprises creating a mask comprising the high sound speed tissue.
11. The method of claim 10, wherein the mask is created from a sound reflection image.
12. The method of claim 10, wherein the mask is created using a k-means segmentation algorithm.
13. The method of claim 1, further comprising comparing a volume averaged sound speed or a percent of high sound speed tissue to a mammographic percent density.
14. The method of claim 1, wherein the risk is calculated without mammographic data.
15. The method of claim 1, wherein the risk comprises a score.
16. The method of claim 15, wherein the score is a number on a 1-5 scale.
17. The method of claim 1, wherein the risk of developing breast cancer is a risk of redeveloping breast cancer.
18. The method of claim 1, further comprising determining the volume averaged sound speed within the volume over a plurality of instances of time.
19. The method of claim 18, wherein the plurality of instances of time comprise at least a portion of a time duration during which a treatment is provided.
20. The method of claim 19, wherein the time duration is during a preventative or an adjuvant time period.

21. The method of claim 19, wherein the treatment comprises at least one element selected from the group consisting of a chemotherapy treatment, a radiation therapy treatment, a cryotherapy treatment, a radiofrequency ablation treatment, a focused ultrasound treatment, and an electroporation treatment.
22. The method of claim 19, wherein the treatment is a preventative treatment.
23. The method of claim 22, wherein the treatment comprises use of tamoxifen, raloxifene, other anti-estrogen drugs, dietary and/or lifestyle interventions.
24. The method of claim 1, wherein the volume comprises at least 20% non-cancerous tissue.
25. A computing system comprising instructions which when executed perform the method of any one of claims 1-24.
27. The method of claim 26, wherein the characterizing occurs prior to and/or within 30 days of a start of a treatment plan.
28. The method of claim 27, wherein the characterizing occurs prior to and/or within 14 days of a start of a treatment plan.
29. The method of claim 26, wherein the treatment plan comprises neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
30. The method of claim 26, wherein the plurality of instance of time are during a preventative or an adjuvant time period.

31. The method of claim 26, wherein the treatment plan comprises at least one element selected from the group consisting of a chemotherapy treatment, a radiation therapy treatment, a cryotherapy treatment, a radiofrequency ablation treatment, a focused ultrasound treatment and an electroporation treatment.

35. A method of analyzing an image of a volume of tissue of a breast, the method comprising:
receiving at least one ultrasound tomography image of the volume at a computing system;
generating a stiffness map from the at least one ultrasound tomography image; and
quantifying relative stiffness percentages of a first type of tissue and a second type of tissue using the computing system.
36. The method of claim 35, wherein the first type of tissue is fibroglandular tissue.
37. The method of claim 35, wherein the second type of tissue is fatty tissue.
38. The method of claim 35, wherein the method further comprises applying an image partitioning process to generate tissue groups by type of tissue, stiffness, or both.
39. The method of claim 38, wherein the image partitioning process to generate tissue groups by type of tissue comprises using a sound speed image.
40. The method of claim 38, wherein the image partitioning process to generate tissue groups by stiffness comprises combining sound speed and attenuation data.
41. The method of claim 35, wherein the quantifying comprises quantifying the relative stiffness percentages for a region of interest within the volume of tissue.
42. The method of claim 35, wherein the quantifying comprises quantifying the relative stiffness percentages for at least 30% of the volume of tissue.
43. The method of claim 35, wherein the method further comprises removing the spatial filter and comparing a filtered image to an un-filtered image.

45. The method of claim 43, wherein the method further comprises quantifying the relative stiffness percentage of a region of interest within the volume of tissue using the filtered image.
46. The method of claim 43, wherein the method further comprises quantifying the relative stiffness percentage for at least 30% of the volume of tissue using the un-filtered image.
47. The method of claim 43, wherein the method further comprises quantifying a stiffness distribution by a stiffness index or another parameter for quantifying the stiffness distribution.

48. The method of claim 35, wherein the identifying comprises characterizing a mass as at least one of a cyst, a fibroadenoma, a cancer, a benign mass, or an unidentified mass based on the relative stiffness percentages.

63. The method of claim 35, further comprising quantifying a location of a peritumoral region.
